values:
Tis I, Lotus Oh Mac. I have returned after a 3 year honey moon with my "Boo", ( As all you hip little teenagers would call your partner ) Jason. We have gotten hitched in Indonesia. We also adopted a son, Tonbat. We are now living in Richmond, Virginia. We bought a home across the street from a country club, do not ask me why, It was Jason's idea. ( I love him ). I hope everyone had a nice holiday and I wish the best!

P.S.

If you are wondering what happened to the old house, and the barn. I sold it to a nice woman, Caterine. God Bless.

Hugs, Kisses, Peace.

- Lotus, Now Married, Oh Mac.

Hello Journal! I have just purchased a new Computer. It is much better than my old. I have not updated because my old computer which is now being burned and i shall save the ashes. Today I took my cows to the slaughter house since they have succesfully breeded and had their fawns, and since they are useless I watched them be slaughtered. It was gruesome, yet beautiful. About Susan and I : i asked her to take my hand in marriage, she said no and we do not date anymore which has broken my heart. I have been reading in magazines, and came across "Gay and Lesbian" marriages. Maybe woman aren't my destiny, I am soul searching for a male partner. Susan and I had intercouse the night before i asked her to marry me. It was the most delightful thing in my life. But I do not understand why I would like to be gay. Please comment me, Lotus, and help me to find my true self. Thankyou for your time and consideration. Good Bye!

-Lotus "Oh" Mac

Hello. Today I am taking up french lessons, my girlfriend always speaks it to me, and I have no idea what she is saying. For all I know, she could be cussing at me! Well, I have found out that I am in love with her, Susan ( my girlfriend). I was surfing the web today, when I came across this "Live Journal". I decided to make one. I have no friends although. Today I will go shopping for a exquistite quisine for my dear. I will have an entire romantic dinner planned for Susan, and I. Well the cows are breeding splendedly. I am very excited for Bess. I will post an entry tomorrow.
-Truly Yours,
 Lotus Mac.
